adjectives.description: circumforaneous (comparative more circumforaneous, superlative most circumforaneous)

entries.meaning: Wandering from place to place or market to market.
examples: Gyrovagues: Monks who were accustomed to wander from place to place. In modern times, perhaps, any of the various circumforaneous proselytizers who go from door to door—Jehovah's Witnesses, Mormons, et al.

entries.meaning: (by extension) Indirect, roundabout, or unnecessarily complex.
